intro: Brachystegia ferruginea, commonly known as the red ironwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Bombacaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and thick, flaky bark. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall and has compound leaves that are alternate and pinnate. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in yellow or greenish-white colors, and it produces capsule fruits that release seeds through explosive dehiscence. The plant is well adapted to dry savanna environments and plays an important role in local ecosystems.
